importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace on the night of October 4, 2025, which marks the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.
Two weeks after Kada Scott disappeared, human remains were found in a shallow grave, marking a pivotal development in the case.
A new news update on October 19, 2025, confirms the arrest of suspect Keon King and the discovery of remains, indicating active progress in the investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance intensified after she was missing for about two weeks, culminating in the discovery of human remains and the arrest of Keon King.

keyTakeAways: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on the night of October 4, 2025, after leaving her workplace.
Human remains believed to belong to Kada Scott were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area.
Police believe Keon King, a 21-year-old man, is responsible for her kidnapping, based on phone contact and a pattern of prior criminal behavior involving another woman.
King was previously charged in a domestic kidnapping case earlier in the year, with charges withdrawn in May 2025 due to a missing witness, and are now being refiled.
A tip from an anonymous source led investigators to the shallow grave and later to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King, which is now under investigation.
Phone tracking and digital evidence show that King had contact with Scott shortly after she left work, and her phone and social media accounts went offline.
The Philadelphia Police Department, with FBI assistance, is investigating a possible pattern of behavior involving multiple kidnappings, suggesting a broader criminal pattern.
Scott’s family, including her mother and father, has expressed deep anguish, urging the public to come forward with any information.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 23-year-old Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, went missing on October 4, 2025, after leaving her workplace. Two weeks later, human remains believed to belong to her were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in a wooded area. Police believe Keon King, a 21-year-old man with a prior domestic kidnapping charge, is responsible. Tracking phone communications led investigators to King, who was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping and the earlier kidnapping of another woman. The investigation, led by the Philadelphia Police Department with FBI assistance, is examining a potential pattern of criminal behavior. A key anonymous tip led to the discovery of the remains and the location of a gold 1999 Toyota Camry linked to King. The family is urging the public to come forward with information, as all leads point toward King and his possible connection to the crime.
title: Police Investigating Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman Find Human Remains in Shallow Grave; Suspect Keon King Arrested
